intro: Phyllanthus nyale, commonly known as the Indian false shamrock, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are composed of three leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Phyllanthus nyale thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and prefers well-drained soil.
